verses.kjv: Now the days of David drew nigh that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying,
verses.ct: As David's time to die approached, he gave these instructions to his son Solomon:

verses.kjv: I go the way of all the earth: be thou strong therefore, and shew thyself a man;
verses.ct: "I'm about to go the way everyone goes. Be strong and prove yourself a man.

verses.kjv: And keep the charge of the LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and his testimonies, as it is written in the law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself:
verses.ct: Follow what the LORD your God requires — live according to his ways, and obey his statutes, commands, regulations, and laws as written in the law of Moses. Then you will succeed in everything you do and everywhere you go.

verses.kjv: That the LORD may continue his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.
verses.ct: If you do this, the LORD will keep the promise he made to me when he said, 'If your descendants are careful to live faithfully in my presence with complete dedication of heart and soul, you will always have someone sitting on the throne of Israel.'

verses.kjv: Moreover thou knowest also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, and what he did to the two captains of the hosts of Israel, unto Abner the son of Ner, and unto Amasa the son of Jether, whom he slew, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his girdle that was about his loins, and in his shoes that were on his feet.
verses.ct: You also know what Joab son of Zeruiah did to me — what he did to the 2 commanders of Israel's armies, Abner son of Ner and Amasa son of Jether. He killed them, shedding the blood of war during peacetime, staining the belt around his waist and the sandals on his feet with that blood.

verses.kjv: Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to the grave in peace.
verses.ct: Use your wisdom to deal with him, and don't let his gray head go down to the grave peacefully.

verses.kjv: But shew kindness unto the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother.
verses.ct: But treat the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite with kindness, and let them eat at your table, because they stood by me when I was fleeing from your brother Absalom.

verses.kjv: And, behold, thou hast with thee Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite of Bahurim, which cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at Jordan, and I sware to him by the LORD, saying, I will not put thee to death with the sword.
verses.ct: And remember, you also have Shimei son of Gera, the Benjaminite from Bahurim, who hurled terrible curses at me when I was heading to Mahanaim. But he came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I swore to him by the LORD, saying, 'I will not execute you.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore hold him not guiltless: for thou art a wise man, and knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him; but his hoar head bring thou down to the grave with blood.
verses.ct: But don't let him go unpunished. You're a wise man, and you'll know what to do with him. Make sure his gray head goes down to the grave in blood."

verses.kjv: So David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David.
verses.ct: Then David died and joined his ancestors, and he was buried in the city of David.

verses.kjv: And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: David had ruled over Israel for 40 years — 7 years in Hebron and 33 years in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then sat Solomon upon the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was established greatly.
verses.ct: Solomon then took his place on the throne of his father David, and his kingdom was firmly established.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, Comest thou peaceably? And he said, Peaceably.
verses.ct: Adonijah son of Haggith came to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother. She asked, "Do you come in peace?" He answered, "Yes, in peace."

verses.kjv: He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And she said, Say on.
verses.ct: Then he said, "There's something I'd like to ask you." She replied, "Go ahead."

verses.kjv: And he said, Thou knowest that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign: howbeit the kingdom is turned about, and is become my brother’s: for it was his from the LORD.
verses.ct: He said, "You know that the kingdom should have been mine, and that all Israel expected me to rule. But things turned out differently, and the kingdom went to my brother, because the LORD gave it to him.

verses.kjv: And now I ask one petition of thee, deny me not. And she said unto him, Say on.
verses.ct: Now I have one request to make of you — please don't refuse me." She said, "Go ahead."

verses.kjv: And he said, Speak, I pray thee, unto Solomon the king, (for he will not say thee nay,) that he give me Abishag the Shunammite to wife.
verses.ct: He said, "Please ask King Solomon — he won't refuse you — to give me Abishag the Shunammite as my wife."

verses.kjv: And Bathsheba said, Well; I will speak for thee unto the king.
verses.ct: Bathsheba replied, "Very well. I'll speak to the king for you."

verses.kjv: Bathsheba therefore went unto king Solomon, to speak unto him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself unto her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a seat to be set for the king’s mother; and she sat on his right hand.
verses.ct: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak to him on Adonijah's behalf. The king stood up to greet her, bowed to her, and then sat down on his throne. He had a seat placed for his mother, and she sat at his right side.

verses.kjv: Then she said, I desire one small petition of thee; I pray thee, say me not nay. And the king said unto her, Ask on, my mother: for I will not say thee nay.
verses.ct: She said, "I have one small request to make of you. Please don't refuse me." The king replied, "Ask away, Mother. I won't refuse you."

verses.kjv: And she said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy brother to wife.
verses.ct: She said, "Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to your brother Adonijah as his wife."

verses.kjv: And king Solomon answered and said unto his mother, And why dost thou ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? ask for him the kingdom also; for he is mine elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.
verses.ct: King Solomon responded to his mother, "Why are you asking for Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? You might as well ask for the kingdom for him too! After all, he's my older brother — and he has the support of Abiathar the priest and Joab son of Zeruiah."

verses.kjv: Then king Solomon sware by the LORD, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah have not spoken this word against his own life.
verses.ct: Then King Solomon swore by the LORD, "May God punish me severely if Adonijah hasn't sealed his own fate by making this request.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, as the LORD liveth, which hath established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who hath made me an house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death this day.
verses.ct: As surely as the LORD lives — the one who established me and placed me on the throne of my father David and who built me a dynasty just as he promised — Adonijah will be executed today."

verses.kjv: And king Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him that he died.
verses.ct: King Solomon gave the order to Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and he struck Adonijah down and killed him.

verses.kjv: And unto Abiathar the priest said the king, Get thee to Anathoth, unto thine own fields; for thou art worthy of death: but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou barest the ark of the LORD God before David my father, and because thou hast been afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted.
verses.ct: To Abiathar the priest, the king said, "Go back to your fields in Anathoth. You deserve to die, but I won't execute you right now, because you carried the ark of the Lord GOD in my father David's presence, and because you shared in all the hardships my father endured."

verses.kjv: So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest unto the LORD; that he might fulfil the word of the LORD, which he spake concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.
verses.ct: So Solomon removed Abiathar from serving as priest of the LORD. This fulfilled the word the LORD had spoken about the family of Eli at Shiloh.

verses.kjv: Then tidings came to Joab: for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
verses.ct: When news of all this reached Joab — who had supported Adonijah, though he had not supported Absalom — Joab fled to the tabernacle of the LORD and grabbed hold of the horns of the altar.

verses.kjv: And it was told king Solomon that Joab was fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD; and, behold, he is by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him.
verses.ct: When King Solomon was told that Joab had fled to the tabernacle of the LORD and was right there beside the altar, Solomon sent Benaiah son of Jehoiada with the order, "Go, strike him down."

verses.kjv: And Benaiah came to the tabernacle of the LORD, and said unto him, Thus saith the king, Come forth. And he said, Nay; but I will die here. And Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.
verses.ct: Benaiah went to the tabernacle of the LORD and said to Joab, "The king says, 'Come out.'" But Joab replied, "No! I will die here." So Benaiah reported back to the king, "This is what Joab said, and this is how he answered me."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away the innocent blood, which Joab shed, from me, and from the house of my father.
verses.ct: The king told him, "Do what he said — strike him down and bury him. This will remove from me and from my father's family the guilt of the innocent blood that Joab shed.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall return his blood upon his own head, who fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and slew them with the sword, my father David not knowing thereof, to wit, Abner the son of Ner, captain of the host of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the host of Judah.
verses.ct: The LORD will bring the consequences of his bloodshed back on his own head, because he attacked and killed 2 men who were more righteous and better than he was — Abner son of Ner, commander of Israel's army, and Amasa son of Jether, commander of Judah's army — and my father David didn't even know about it.

verses.kjv: Their blood shall therefore return upon the head of Joab, and upon the head of his seed for ever: but upon David, and upon his seed, and upon his house, and upon his throne, shall there be peace for ever from the LORD.
verses.ct: The responsibility for their blood will rest on Joab and his descendants forever. But for David, his descendants, his dynasty, and his throne, there will be lasting peace from the LORD."

verses.kjv: So Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up, and fell upon him, and slew him: and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
verses.ct: So Benaiah son of Jehoiada went and struck Joab down and killed him. He was buried at his home in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the host: and Zadok the priest did the king put in the room of Abiathar.
verses.ct: The king appointed Benaiah son of Jehoiada as commander of the army in Joab's place, and he appointed Zadok as priest in place of Abiathar.

verses.kjv: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Build thee an house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence any whither.
verses.ct: Then the king summoned Shimei and told him, "Build yourself a house in Jerusalem and live there. Don't leave the city for any reason.

verses.kjv: For it shall be, that on the day thou goest out, and passest over the brook Kidron, thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt surely die: thy blood shall be upon thine own head.
verses.ct: The day you leave and cross the Kidron Valley, you can be absolutely certain that you will die. Your death will be your own fault."

verses.kjv: And Shimei said unto the king, The saying is good: as my lord the king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.
verses.ct: Shimei replied to the king, "That's a fair arrangement. Your servant will do exactly as my lord the king has said." So Shimei lived in Jerusalem for a long time.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away unto Achish son of Maachah king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, Behold, thy servants be in Gath.
verses.ct: But after 3 years, 2 of Shimei's slaves ran away to Achish son of Maacah, king of Gath. When Shimei was told, "Your slaves are in Gath,"

verses.kjv: And Shimei arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants: and Shimei went, and brought his servants from Gath.
verses.ct: he saddled his donkey and traveled to Gath to see Achish and retrieve his slaves. Shimei went and brought his slaves back from Gath.

verses.kjv: And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and was come again.
verses.ct: When Solomon was informed that Shimei had left Jerusalem, gone to Gath, and returned,

verses.kjv: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Did I not make thee to swear by the LORD, and protested unto thee, saying, Know for a certain, on the day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any whither, that thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst unto me, The word that I have heard is good.
verses.ct: the king summoned Shimei and said to him, "Didn't I make you swear by the LORD and warn you clearly, 'The day you leave and go anywhere, you can be certain you will die'? And you told me, 'That's a fair arrangement. I agree.'

verses.kjv: Why then hast thou not kept the oath of the LORD, and the commandment that I have charged thee with?
verses.ct: So why didn't you keep the oath you made before the LORD and obey the command I gave you?"

verses.kjv: The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou knowest all the wickedness which thine heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my father: therefore the LORD shall return thy wickedness upon thine own head;
verses.ct: The king also said to Shimei, "You know in your heart all the evil things you did to my father David. Now the LORD is bringing the consequences of your wickedness back on your own head.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the LORD for ever.
verses.ct: But King Solomon will be blessed, and David's throne will be established in the LORD's presence forever."

verses.kjv: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; which went out, and fell upon him, that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
verses.ct: Then the king gave the order to Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who went out and struck Shimei down, and he died. So the kingdom was firmly secured under Solomon's control.
